item.title: Podcast #044 – Let’s Talk About Some Vidya Gamez
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: In this week’s edition of the OoT Podcast, Jordan and Mike dive back into some video game talk with a few recent releases that have been on their minds including Retro City Rampage, Resident Evil 6, and Borderlands 2. Also, it is made abundantly clear that Order of Týr is, in fact, on the [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s edition of the OoT Podcast, Jordan and Mike dive back into some video game talk with a few recent releases that have been on their minds including Retro City Rampage, Resident Evil 6, and Borderlands 2. Also, it is made abundantly clear that Order of Týr is, in fact, on the internet.



Music: Machinae Supremacy - Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima
item.itunes:keywords: Borderlands 2, Retro City Rampage, Resident Evil 6, Video Games, Chiptunes, metal
item.itunes:subtitle: - In this week's edition of the OoT Podcast, Jordan and Mike dive back into some video game talk with a few recent releases that have been on their minds including Retro City Rampage, Resident Evil 6, and Borderlands 2. Also,
item.itunes:summary:
In this week's edition of the OoT Podcast, Jordan and Mike dive back into some video game talk with a few recent releases that have been on their minds including Retro City Rampage, Resident Evil 6, and Borderlands 2. Also, it is made abundantly clear that Order of Týr is, in fact, on the internet.
Music: Machinae Supremacy - Sidology 3 - Apex Ultima
item.itunes:author: Order of Týr

item.title: Podcast #043 – The OoTPC is B-A-C-K
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: We talk about things that happened…because, you know…things happened…and my mic craps out when I get excited, but the OoT Podcast is back!!!! Music: Machinae Supremacy - Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima

item.title: Podcast #042 – Sonic Generations and Catherine Spoiler Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Mike spends some time geeking out about some of the Easter Eggs sprinkled throughout Sonic Generations (spoilers) and then Jordan leads an in-depth discussion on Catherine (more spoilers). There is also some talk about Grasshopper Manufacture’s upcoming game, Lollipop Chainsaw. Oh and apparently Mike still needs to play Bayonetta. Music: Machinae Supremacy - Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima
item.content:encoded:
Mike spends some time geeking out about some of the Easter Eggs sprinkled throughout Sonic Generations (spoilers) and then Jordan leads an in-depth discussion on Catherine (more spoilers). There is also some talk about Grasshopper Manufacture’s upcoming game, Lollipop Chainsaw. Oh and apparently Mike still needs to play Bayonetta.


Music: Machinae Supremacy - Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima
item.itunes:keywords: Sonic The Hedgehog, Catherine, Katherine, Order of Týr, Bayonetta, Lollipop Chainsaw, Video Games

item.title: Podcast #041 – Fantasy/Comic Con, Online Passes, What we’re playing/watching
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Still on a massive high from the Memphis Comic & Fantasy Convention, Jables and I discuss our comic con experiences, what games we’re playing/going to play, and what web series we’ve been into lately. Also, Online Passes rant, because VIDEO GAMES. Music: Machinae Supremacy – Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima
item.content:encoded:
Still on a massive high from the Memphis Comic & Fantasy Convention, Jables and I discuss our comic con experiences, what games we’re playing/going to play, and what web series we’ve been into lately. Also, Online Passes rant, because VIDEO GAMES.


Music: Machinae Supremacy – Sidology 3 – Apex Ultima

item.title: Podcast #029 – MK Legacy, PSN Woes, and Project Cafe
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: Due to raging storms, Donna is unable to command the podcast this evening, so we make due without her by talk a little more about Mortal Kombat Legacy, recount Sony’s woes with the recent and on-going PSN outage, and then discuss Nintendo’s officially confirm new console codenamed Project Cafe. Music: Xenoblade – Mechanical Rhythm
item.content:encoded:
Due to raging storms, Donna is unable to command the podcast this evening, so we make due without her by talk a little more about Mortal Kombat Legacy, recount Sony’s woes with the recent and on-going PSN outage, and then discuss Nintendo’s officially confirm new console codenamed Project Cafe.

Music: Xenoblade – Mechanical Rhythm
item.itunes:keywords: Order of Týr,video games,Order of Tyr,Mortal Kombat,Mortal Kombat Legacy,PSN,Sony,Playstation,PS3,Nintendo,Project Cafe
item.itunes:subtitle: Due to raging storms, Donna is unable to command the podcast this evening, so we make due without her by talk a little more about Mortal Kombat Legacy, recount Sony's woes with the recent and on-going PSN outage,

item.title: Podcast #026 – DNF Special Edition, Press Start 2
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: In this week’s episode, we talk about releasing Ignite the Desire on the OCRemix forums. We also discuss some upcoming games on Steam, the Duke Nukem Forever Balls of Steel Edition, and the sequel to one of the best (if not THE best) video game movies ever made, Press Start 2 Continue! Music: Danimal Cannon [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this week’s episode, we talk about releasing Ignite the Desire on the OCRemix forums. We also discuss some upcoming games on Steam, the Duke Nukem Forever Balls of Steel Edition, and the sequel to one of the best (if not THE best) video game movies ever made, Press Start 2 Continue!

Music: Danimal Cannon – Lucca/Fanfare from Chrono Trigger

If you’re not familiar with Danimal Cannon, he’s an awesome musician/guitarist/mixing engineer who does video game remixes and music with The Bad Dudes and his band Armcannon. Check him out…you’ll be glad you did!
item.itunes:keywords: Portal 2,Crysis 2,Duke Nukem Forever,Video Game Music,Video Games
item.itunes:subtitle: In this week's episode, we talk about releasing Ignite the Desire on the OCRemix forums. We also discuss some upcoming games on Steam, the Duke Nukem Forever Balls of Steel Edition, and the sequel to one of the best (if not THE best) video game movies ...
item.itunes:summary:
In this week's episode, we talk about releasing Ignite the Desire on the OCRemix forums. We also discuss some upcoming games on Steam, the Duke Nukem Forever Balls of Steel Edition, and the sequel to one of the best (if not THE best) video game movies ever made, Press Start 2 Continue!
Music: Danimal Cannon - Lucca/Fanfare from Chrono Trigger
If you're not familiar with Danimal Cannon, he's an awesome musician/guitarist/mixing engineer who does video game remixes and music with The Bad Dudes and his band Armcannon. Check him out...you'll be glad you did!
item.itunes:author: Order of Týr

item.title: Podcast #022 – OoT Community and VGMusic NerdRAGE!
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: Episode 22 houses the inception of the idea of Order of Týr as a community effort spearheaded by our music but driven by everyone. We also go through What We’re Playing, and I rage hard (notice the lack of composure) against a Kotaku.com article which demeans video game music and musicians. Music: Another Bound Neo [...]
item.content:encoded:
Episode 22 houses the inception of the idea of Order of Týr as a community effort spearheaded by our music but driven by everyone. We also go through What We’re Playing, and I rage hard (notice the lack of composure) against a Kotaku.com article which demeans video game music and musicians.

Music: Another Bound Neo – Trample Machine
item.itunes:keywords: video games,music,Donkey Kong Country Returns,Sonic Colors,CES,3DS,Nintendo
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 22 houses the inception of the idea of Order of Týr as a community effort spearheaded by our music but driven by everyone. We also go through What We're Playing, and I rage hard (notice the lack of composure) against a Kotaku.
item.itunes:summary:
Episode 22 houses the inception of the idea of Order of Týr as a community effort spearheaded by our music but driven by everyone. We also go through What We're Playing, and I rage hard (notice the lack of composure) against a Kotaku.com article which demeans video game music and musicians.
Music: Another Bound Neo - Trample Machine

item.title: Podcast #021 – Back from the Holidaze
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: Order of Týr is back with the 2011 version of ourselves which are not much different than the 2010 version! item.title: Podcast #020 – Games of the Year 2010
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: In this, our final podcast of 2010, we discuss the games we played this year including the best and worst parts of them. At the end, we order our top picks from the games discussed. Music: Bayonetta – After Burner (Climax Mix)

item.title: Podcast #016 – WoW Trolled, Music Reviews, New Games
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: In this riveting tale, we complain about non-standard memory card formats and friends usurping our World of Warcraft sobriety, review Therion’s new album Sitra Ahra and the OST from Star Ocean: The Second Story/Second Evolution, and talk about several news games on the block. (NOTE: This isn’t the exact track, but you get the idea [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this riveting tale, we complain about non-standard memory card formats and friends usurping our World of Warcraft sobriety, review Therion’s new album Sitra Ahra and the OST from Star Ocean: The Second Story/Second Evolution, and talk about several news games on the block.

(NOTE: This isn’t the exact track, but you get the idea =)
MUSIC: Gears of War – Train Wreck (Locust Theme)
item.itunes:keywords: Memory Stick Pro Duo,Therion,Sitra Ahra,Star Ocean,Donkey Kong Returns,Splatterhouse,Majin and the Forsaken Kingdom,Gran Turismo 5,Word of Warcraft,WoW
item.itunes:subtitle: In this riveting tale, we complain about non-standard memory card formats and friends usurping our World of Warcraft sobriety, review Therion's new album Sitra Ahra and the OST from Star Ocean: The Second Story/Second Evolution,
item.itunes:summary:
In this riveting tale, we complain about non-standard memory card formats and friends usurping our World of Warcraft sobriety, review Therion's new album Sitra Ahra and the OST from Star Ocean: The Second Story/Second Evolution, and talk about several news games on the block.
(NOTE: This isn't the exact track, but you get the idea =) MUSIC: Gears of War - Train Wreck (Locust Theme)
item.itunes:author: Order of Týr

item.title: Podcast #015 – Album Infoz, Silent Hill 8/New Movie
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: In this episode, we talk a bit more about the new album, Flames of Destiny. We also do What We’re Playing part IV. I rant about Silent Hill 8, the complete departure of Akira Yamaoaka from the franchise, and the new movie, and we do a quick overview of some news games recently released. Music: [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, we talk a bit more about the new album, Flames of Destiny. We also do What We’re Playing part IV. I rant about Silent Hill 8, the complete departure of Akira Yamaoaka from the franchise, and the new movie, and we do a quick overview of some news games recently released.

Music: Vanilla Ice – Ninja Rap
item.itunes:keywords: video games,order of tyr,music,metal,power metal,silent hill,bayonetta
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we talk a bit more about the new album, Flames of Destiny. We also do What We're Playing part IV. I rant about Silent Hill 8, the complete departure of Akira Yamaoaka from the franchise, and the new movie,
item.itunes:summary:
In this episode, we talk a bit more about the new album, Flames of Destiny. We also do What We're Playing part IV. I rant about Silent Hill 8, the complete departure of Akira Yamaoaka from the franchise, and the new movie, and we do a quick overview of some news games recently released.
Music: Vanilla Ice - Ninja Rap
item.itunes:author: Order of Týr

item.title: Podcast #014 – Silent Hill 2 and Music Nerdery
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: WARNING: Listen up for the spoiler alerts in this episode! =) We update you on the recording of Flames of Destiny, talk about a couple songs on the album, nerd out about some crazy music, [spoiler]talk about beating Silent Hill 2 and the various endings[/spoiler], and complain about “trained” salespeople and their pushiness (and sometimes [...]
item.content:encoded:
WARNING: Listen up for the spoiler alerts in this episode! =) We update you on the recording of Flames of Destiny, talk about a couple songs on the album, nerd out about some crazy music, [spoiler]talk about beating Silent Hill 2 and the various endings[/spoiler], and complain about “trained” salespeople and their pushiness (and sometimes out right lying) to get a new or hot product sold.

MUSIC: Final Fantasy: Mystic Quest – Heat of Battle
item.itunes:keywords: music,silent hill,video games,drum corps,bluecoats,big box stores

MUSIC: Final Fantasy: Mystic Quest - Heat of Battle

item.title: Podcast #010 – Free MMOs, VG Interests, and Opera?!
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: In this episode, we discuss many a game including some MMOs which have recent opened up a free platform. We also talk about what we like (and dislike) in games, and we whip out the music nerds within and speak a little about opera. (NOTE: This game is called Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of [...]
item.content:encoded:
In this episode, we discuss many a game including some MMOs which have recent opened up a free platform. We also talk about what we like (and dislike) in games, and we whip out the music nerds within and speak a little about opera.

(NOTE: This game is called Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny outside of Japan)
MUSIC: Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana 2 – Slasher Blue (from Red Lucifer Rising – the arranged track album)

item.title: Podcast #009 – Move/Kinect and Duke Nukem Forever
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: We make excuses about being in the studio, talk about some games we’ve been playing lately, moan and groan about the Move and Kinect, Guile’s Theme plays for way too long, and rejoice in the recent glorious announcement regarding Duke Nukem Forever. MUSIC: Footprintz – Angels (Sy & Unknown Remix)
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Podcast #005 – Donna Talks Games!, AAA Video Games
item.dc:creator: Jordan
item.description: Donna makes a discovery and learns the idea of the modern blockbuster video game. Mike tries to spoil BioShock again, and I talk a lot (..a lot), and for some reason I pronounce Modus Operandi as Modus Apperandi. Enjoy! =D The music is Journey to Gardaena from our album, The Wizard’s War.
item.content:encoded:
Donna makes a discovery and learns the idea of the modern blockbuster video game. Mike tries to spoil BioShock again, and I talk a lot (..a lot), and for some reason I pronounce Modus Operandi as Modus Apperandi. Enjoy! =D

The music is Journey to Gardaena from our album, The Wizard’s War.
item.itunes:subtitle: Donna makes a discovery and learns the idea of the modern blockbuster video game. Mike tries to spoil BioShock again, and I talk a lot (..a lot), and for some reason I pronounce Modus Operandi as Modus Apperandi. Enjoy! =D -
